title: Salisbury Steak Meatballs with Mushroom Gravy
description: The meatball version of Salisbury steak! Be prepared to marvel at how incredibly juicy and tender these meatballs are. And that mushroom gravy - wow!
ingredients: 3 tsp dijon mustard OR 2 tsp dry mustard powder
instructions: Place the breadcrumbs in a large bowl. Using a standard box grater, grate the onion over the panko so it soaks in. Mix through.
Add remaining Meatball ingredients and mix well with your hands until thoroughly combined.
Roll 20 to 22 balls (1 1/2 tablespoons of mixture).
Mix slurry ingredients in a bowl until smooth.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Cook meatballs, using tablespoons to roll until browned on the outside but still raw inside. Remove onto a plate and set aside.

Melt butter in the same skillet still on high. Cook mushrooms until they start to soften (~ 2 minutes). Add salt, pepper and the garlic, then cook for a further 2 minutes until the garlic is golden and mushrooms are soft.
Add beef stock, salt, pepper and slurry, then stir to combine.

Once the liquid starts to simmer, add meatballs and any juices pooled on the plate. Adjust heat to medium so it's simmering gently and cook for 5 minutes until gravy is thickened and meatballs are cooked through.
Serve over mash sprinkled with parsley if desired.
tips: LEFTOVERS can be stored for 3 to 4 days in the fridge, or frozen.

structured_content.content: These Salisbury steak meatballs with mushroom gravy are a delicious twist on a classic dish. The meatballs are incredibly juicy and tender, and the mushroom gravy adds a rich, savory flavor that will have you coming back for seconds.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under an hour
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners, entertaining, or special events
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Can be stored for 3 to 4 days in the fridge, or frozen for later use

structured_content.content: This recipe was inspired by a dish I had at a local restaurant. I loved the combination of the tender meatballs and the rich mushroom gravy, and I knew I had to recreate it at home. It's now a favorite in my household and I'm sure it will be in yours too!

• Main ingredient: Ground beef is the star of this dish. Choose a lean ground beef for the best results.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and a beef bouillon cube add depth and complexity to the flavor of the meatballs and gravy.
  • Supporting ingredients: Panko breadcrumbs, onion, and egg help to bind the meatballs together and add texture. Mushrooms, beef stock, and flour are used to create the savory gravy.
  • Equipment needed: You'll need a large skillet, a box grater, and a bowl for mixing the meatball ingredients.

Preparation:
Start by grating the onion over the breadcrumbs and mixing it in. Then, add the remaining meatball ingredients and mix until well combined. Roll the mixture into 20 to 22 balls.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Brown the meatballs in a skillet with olive oil, then set them aside. In the same skillet, sauté the mushrooms with butter, salt, pepper, and garlic. Add the beef stock, salt, pepper, and slurry to the skillet and stir to combine. Once the liquid starts to simmer, add the meatballs back into the skillet and cook until the gravy is thickened and the meatballs are cooked through.
Finishing Touches:
Serve the meatballs and gravy over mashed potatoes, rice, or pasta, and sprinkle with chopped parsley if desired.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Be sure to cook the meatballs until they are browned but still raw inside. They will finish cooking in the gravy.
  • Don't skip the step of sautéing the mushrooms. This adds a lot of flavor to the gravy.
  • Adjust the heat to medium once you add the meatballs back into the skillet. This will ensure that the gravy doesn't boil and the meatballs cook gently.
  • Leftovers can be stored in the fridge for 3 to 4 days, or frozen for later use.

structured_content.content: I love serving these Salisbury steak meatballs for family dinners. The rich flavors and comforting nature of the dish always bring smiles to the table. Plus, the leftovers make for a delicious lunch the next day!

If you want to add a bit more flavor to this dish, consider adding a splash of red wine to the gravy, or sprinkling the finished dish with a bit of grated Parmesan cheese. Fresh herbs like thyme or rosemary would also be a great addition.
This dish pairs well with a side of green beans or a simple salad. For a beverage, consider a full-bodied red wine or a craft beer.
If you're looking to make this dish vegetarian, you could substitute the ground beef with a plant-based meat substitute. You could also use turkey or chicken mince for a lighter version.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a box grater to grate the onion directly over the breadcrumbs. This will allow the onion juice to soak into the breadcrumbs, adding more flavor to the meatballs.
  • When forming the meatballs, try not to pack them too tightly. This will help them stay tender and juicy.
  • Be sure to simmer the gravy gently once the meatballs are added. This will ensure that the meatballs cook evenly and stay tender.

structured_content.content: With a little bit of preparation and some simple ingredients, you can create a restaurant-quality dish right in your own kitchen. These Salisbury steak meatballs are sure to become a favorite in your household. Happy cooking!
